sentence.Network_en: It was foolhardy to have refused.
It would be foolhardy to sail in weather like this.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种天气出航就是瞎冒险。

sentence.Network_en: He paid for the foolhardy act with his life.
sentence.Network_cn: 他为鲁莽的举动付出了生命的代价.

list.abs: Only the English can be so foolhardy ., 只有英国人才会这么傻.
ferocious act 野蛮的举动foolhardy act 鲁莽的举动foolish act 愚蠢的行为
a challenge to do something dangerous or foolhardy ., 挑战做某些危险或愚蠢的事.
after a quarter century of terrorism designed to drive out even the most foolhardy investor how can the place be doing so well ?即使最为莽撞的投资者也该望而生畏的恐怖活动已进行了1/4个世纪之久，这地方怎么还能弄得如此之好?

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French folhardi, from fol 'foolish' + hardi 'bold' (see hardy)

entry.def: If you describe behaviour as foolhardy, you disapprove of it because it is extremely risky.

example.ex: When he tested an early vaccine on himself, some described the act as foolhardy...
example.tran: 当他在自己身上试验还处在初级阶段的疫苗时，有些人说他的行为是蛮干。

example.ex: It was foolhardy to have refused.

means.word_mean: 1. marked by unthinking boldness; with defiant disregard for danger or consequences;

sentences.sentence: "foolhardy enough to try to seize the gun from the hijacker"
"became the fiercest and most reckless of partisans"-Macaulay
"a rash attempt to climb the World Trade Center"
